Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מְגוּרֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translit: Vayyeshev ya'akov be'eretz megurei aviv be'eretz kena'an.
English: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה תֹּלְד֣וֹת יַעֲקֹ֗ב יוֹסֵ֞ף בֶּן־שְׁבַֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֨ה רֹעֶ֤ה אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ בַּצֹּ֔אן וְה֣וּא נַ֗עַר אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י בִלְהָ֛ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י זִלְפָּ֖ה נְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־דִּבָּתָ֥ם רָעָ֖ה אֶל־אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translit: Elleh toledot ya'akov yosef ben-sheva-esreh shanah hayah ro'eh et-echav batzon vehu na'ar et-benei vilhah ve'et-benei zilpah neshei aviv vayyave yosef et-dibbatam ra'ah el-avihem.
English: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.

Hebrew: וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָהַ֤ב אֶת־יוֹסֵף֙ מִכָּל־בָּנָ֔יו כִּֽי־בֶן־זְקֻנִ֥ים ה֖וּא ל֑וֹ וְעָ֥שָׂה ל֖וֹ כְּתֹ֥נֶת פַּסִּֽים׃
Translit: Veyisra'el ahav et-yosef mikkol-banav ki-ven-zekunim hu lo ve'asah lo ketonet passim.
English: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ אֶחָ֗יו כִּֽי־אֹת֞וֹ אָהַ֤ב אֲבִיהֶם֙ מִכָּל־אֶחָ֔יו וַֽיִּשְׂנְא֖וּ אֹת֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יָכְל֖וּ דַּבְּר֥וֹ לְשָׁלֹֽם׃
Translit: Vayyir'u echav ki-oto ahav avihem mikkol-echav vayyisne'u oto velo yachelu dabbero leshalom.
English: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֤ם יוֹסֵף֙ חֲל֔וֹם וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאֶחָ֑יו וַיּוֹסִ֥פוּ ע֖וֹד שְׂנֹ֥א אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: Vayyachalom yosef chalom vayyagged le'echav vayyosifu od seno oto.
English: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֕א הַחֲל֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָלָֽמְתִּי׃
Translit: Vayyomer aleihem shim'u-na hachalom hazzeh asher chalameti.
English: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:

Hebrew: וְ֠הִנֵּה אֲנַ֜חְנוּ מְאַלְּמִ֤ים אֲלֻמִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה קָ֥מָה אֲלֻמָּתִ֖י וְגַם־נִצָּ֑בָה וְהִנֵּ֤ה תְסֻבֶּ֨ינָה֙ אֲלֻמֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וַתִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖יןָ לַאֲלֻמָּתִֽי׃
Translit: Vehinneh anachnu me'allemim alummim betoch hassadeh vehinneh kamah alummati vegam-nitzavah vehinneh tesubbeinah alummoteichem vattishtachaveina la'alummati.
English: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ אֶחָ֔יו הֲמָלֹ֤ךְ תִּמְלֹךְ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ אִם־מָשׁ֥וֹל תִּמְשֹׁ֖ל בָּ֑נוּ וַיּוֹסִ֤פוּ עוֹד֙ שְׂנֹ֣א אֹת֔וֹ עַל־חֲלֹמֹתָ֖יו וְעַל־דְּבָרָֽיו׃
Translit: Vayyomru lo echav hamaloch timloch aleinu im-mashol timshol banu vayyosifu od seno oto al-chalomotav ve'al-devarav.
English: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֥ם עוֹד֙ חֲל֣וֹם אַחֵ֔ר וַיְסַפֵּ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ לְאֶחָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֨ה חָלַ֤מְתִּֽי חֲלוֹם֙ ע֔וֹד וְהִנֵּ֧ה הַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ וְהַיָּרֵ֗חַ וְאַחַ֤ד עָשָׂר֙ כּֽוֹכָבִ֔ים מִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֖ים לִֽי׃
Translit: Vayyachalom od chalom acher vaysapper oto le'echav vayyomer hinneh chalamti chalom od vehinneh hashemesh vehayyareach ve'achad asar kochavim mishtachavim li.
English: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.

Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֣ר אֶל־אָבִיו֮ וְאֶל־אֶחָיו֒ וַיִּגְעַר־בּ֣וֹ אָבִ֔יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ מָ֛ה הַחֲל֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָלָ֑מְתָּ הֲב֣וֹא נָב֗וֹא אֲנִי֙ וְאִמְּךָ֣ וְאַחֶ֔יךָ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֥ת לְךָ֖ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translit: Vaysapper el-aviv ve'el-echav vayyig'ar-bo aviv vayyomer lo mah hachalom hazzeh asher chalameta havo navo ani ve'immecha ve'acheicha lehishtachavot lecha aretzah.
English: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?

Hebrew: וַיְקַנְאוּ־ב֖וֹ אֶחָ֑יו וְאָבִ֖יו שָׁמַ֥ר אֶת־הַדָּבָֽר׃
Translit: Vaykan'u-vo echav ve'aviv shamar et-haddavar.
English: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אֶחָ֑יו לִרְע֛וֹת אֶׄתׄ־צֹ֥אן אֲבִיהֶ֖ם בִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translit: Vayyelechu echav lir'ot et-tzon avihem bishchem.
English: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־יוֹסֵ֗ף הֲל֤וֹא אַחֶ֨יךָ֙ רֹעִ֣ים בִּשְׁכֶ֔ם לְכָ֖ה וְאֶשְׁלָחֲךָ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translit: Vayyomer yisra'el el-yosef halo acheicha ro'im bishchem lechah ve'eshlachacha aleihem vayyomer lo hinneni.
English: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ לֶךְ־נָ֨א רְאֵ֜ה אֶת־שְׁל֤וֹם אַחֶ֨יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁל֣וֹם הַצֹּ֔אן וַהֲשִׁבֵ֖נִי דָּבָ֑ר וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֨הוּ֙ מֵעֵ֣מֶק חֶבְר֔וֹן וַיָּבֹ֖א שְׁכֶֽמָה׃
Translit: Vayyomer lo lech-na re'eh et-shelom acheicha ve'et-shelom hatzon vahashiveni davar vayyishlachehu me'emek chevron vayyavo shechemah.
English: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָאֵ֣הוּ אִ֔ישׁ וְהִנֵּ֥ה תֹעֶ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיִּשְׁאָלֵ֧הוּ הָאִ֛ישׁ לֵאמֹ֖ר מַה־תְּבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translit: Vayyimtza'ehu ish vehinneh to'eh bassadeh vayyish'alehu ha'ish lemor mah-tevakkesh.
English: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־אַחַ֖י אָנֹכִ֣י מְבַקֵּ֑שׁ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י אֵיפֹ֖ה הֵ֥ם רֹעִֽים׃
Translit: Vayyomer et-achai anochi mevakkesh haggidah-na li eifoh hem ro'im.
English: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָאִישׁ֙ נָסְע֣וּ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֤י שָׁמַ֨עְתִּי֙ אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה דֹּתָ֑יְנָה וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ יוֹסֵף֙ אַחַ֣ר אֶחָ֔יו וַיִּמְצָאֵ֖ם בְּדֹתָֽן׃
Translit: Vayyomer ha'ish nase'u mizzeh ki shama'ti omerim nelechah dotayenah vayyelech yosef achar echav vayyimtza'em bedotan.
English: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּבְטֶ֨רֶם֙ יִקְרַ֣ב אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּֽתְנַכְּל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translit: Vayyir'u oto merachok uveterem yikrav aleihem vayyitnakkelu oto lahamito.
English: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו הִנֵּ֗ה בַּ֛עַל הַחֲלֹמ֥וֹת הַלָּזֶ֖ה בָּֽא׃
Translit: Vayyomru ish el-achiv hinneh ba'al hachalomot hallazeh ba.
English: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה לְכ֣וּ וְנַֽהַרְגֵ֗הוּ וְנַשְׁלִכֵ֨הוּ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד הַבֹּר֔וֹת וְאָמַ֕רְנוּ חַיָּ֥ה רָעָ֖ה אֲכָלָ֑תְהוּ וְנִרְאֶ֕ה מַה־יִּהְי֖וּ חֲלֹמֹתָֽיו׃
Translit: Ve'attah lechu venahargehu venashlichehu be'achad habborot ve'amarnu chayyah ra'ah achalatehu venir'eh mah-yihyu chalomotav. Vayyishma re'uven vayyatzilehu miyyadam vayyomer lo nakkennu nafesh.
English: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע רְאוּבֵ֔ן וַיַּצִּלֵ֖הוּ מִיָּדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נַכֶּ֖נּוּ נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translit: Vayyomer alehem re'uven al-tishpechu-dam hashlichu oto el-habbor hazzeh asher bammidbar veyad al-tishlechu-vo lema'an hatzil oto miyyadam lahashivo el-aviv.
English: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
